item.description:
A student from Smith College has confirmed a screening of the film, "Improbable Collapse: The Demolition of our Republic." This film proposes to provide visual and scientific evidence of a government cover-up and covert actions regarding the horrendous crimes of September 11, 2001, especially on the puzzling collapse of the Twin Towers and WTC Building 7.

Following the film, the public is welcome and invited to share different
points of view, to debate the issues, inviting students to join in on the discussions.

The following is what Zoe, a student, shared by email:

Hey. . . it's been confirmed! In Seelye 106, on Tuesday, May 1st at 730
pm, and I have the space until 11 (11:15) pm. For the event description,
I wrote:

"A showing of the film 'Improbable Collapse,' a flim discussing the
issues raised by the accepted [official] explanation for the World Trade Center
collapse. Discussion afterwards with members of a local grassroots
organization, including a debate and question and answer session.
Audience skepticism, interest, and engagement of any kind is greatly
encouraged and actively solicited for a topic that rarely receives space
in an academic environment."

If you would add or change anything, let me know. Also, for a basic
piece of paper advertising this event, what other information would you
like on it? The name of your organization is FlyBy News, no?

I don't know many people who have views on this subject, much less are
prepared to take the opposing side (opposing to you). If you know of
anyone, though, I could contact them myself. It would be nice to have a
real debate. I'll ask around. In any case, get back to me and I'll start
sending emails out to the government, engineering, sociology, film and
physics departments.

>

Besides this May 1 event, the next meetup will be on may 23rd at the media ed.
foundation community meeting space.. from 6pm..

also.. there will be a meetup on this at the brattleboro common ground after
community meal .. at 7:30pm, Tuesday May 8. I believe we will be showing a
film at this event.. more info will follow..

thanks for all your interest.. please confirm if you can make this meetup at smith..
and this will be a good opportunity to see improbable collapse that might have
missed the tour with mike berger. but we got some of his Q&A presentations
that were phenomenal.. recorded.. perhaps we could show this film when edited
at may 23rd meetup? till later,

jonathan

i will have information on this event at smith.. also at
FlybyNews.com
item.name: IMPROBABLE COLLAPSE - Smith College - May 1
